<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_431105_cand_ass_question_library"> <x_431105_cand_ass_question_library action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <answers>Increasingly flexible hiring and firing rules will lead to a loss of job security for most employees.
In a competitive global marketplace employers need to respond flexibly to changing workforce requirements. ‘The uncertainty created for individuals by regular job changes can be offset by the confidence that adequate welfare will be available in times of need.
Moving regularly between shortterm jobs is likely to be detrimental to an individual’s career advancement.</answers> <assessment_state display_value="Preselection CBT">5165ad5897442110a4deb9dfe153af6f</assessment_state> <correct_answer>Increasingly flexible hiring and firing rules will lead to a loss of job security for most employees.</correct_answer> <default_max_value>8</default_max_value> <number>QLB0001020</number> <question>Being flexible about the possibility of changing jobs over a lifetime career may be needed in a knowledge-based economy and a globalised world. A policy of flexicurity is the answer to this. Flexicurity means a welfare state model with a pro-active labour market policy. The model is a combination of flexible hiring and firing rules (flexibility for employers) and high benefits for the unemployed (security for the employees). It does not mean encouraging job insecurity — people working in a series of short-term or temporary jobs, for example. It is rather about creating a broader employment context where job mobility, and especially upward mobility to jobs with higher pay and better working conditions, forms part of a normal career pattern.
Which of the following statements is correct?</question> <selection_criteria display_value="Verbal Reasoning">1a4e91d097442110a4deb9dfe153af4c</selection_criteria> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2022-12-24 14:56:18</sys_created_on> <sys_id>a5b07d9497842110a4deb9dfe153af45</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>3</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2022-12-25 06:45:23</sys_updated_on> </x_431105_cand_ass_question_library> </record_update>
